txt.en: 'That might be unwise, my lord.'
'This goblin has been elevated by Gorgar.'
'If Gorgar wins this power struggle...'
Gorgar's Bodyguard
Talk to Shulgolb
An unexpected visitor has interrupted your plans.
Talk to Lumbag
Gorgar has chosen you for some unknown purpose.
Gorgar has need of a goblin to acquire a valuable treasure for him.
Gorgar believes there is a mithril treasure in the room on this side of the rock-fall.
Acquiring the mithril hammer for Gorgar was only the beginning.
Gorgar the Ruthless has sent you to command the loyalty of Ránulur, Chieftain of Wargs.
You served Gorgar faithfully and well.
'I am looking for a goblin.'
'You there! The short one! Come here!'

'We are taking a big risk trusting you again, Glúrkub. How are we to know you don't plan to trick us, and turn us in to Gorgar?\n\n'Pox and maggots, there's nothing for it. We'll fight through the dwarf-lines and make for freedom... and if you betray us, Glúrkub, I'll see that you die for it!'
The War of Three Peaks is underway!
'I could see which way the skull was rolling.'
'This is... this is not far enough....\n\n'We have to... we have to keep going....'
You ran far from the battle-lines, eventually finding yourself on distant snowfields.
'I needed a new plan.'
You have run with Muzmák from the War of Three Peaks... but how far will be enough?
'Actually... let's skip this part.'
'Anyway, in time we found ourselves far from the battle, on a distant snowfield.'

'If what the Dragon has said is true... the dwarves are doomed to fail. Do we flee from certain victory, Glúrkub?'

Muzmák stares into the sky.

'We should return to Gundabad. I do not know what ever compelled us to leave. That is our place. The new Lord of Gundabad commands it.'
Hrímil Frost-heart has emerged from her icy prison behind the Anvil of Winterstith!
'I told you, didn't I?'
Muzmák stands in silence upon the snowfield.
'Sometimes... sometimes plans change.'
Carry out the wishes of Gorgar the Ruthless
Talk to Muzmák during the War of Three Peaks

'Are you sure this plan of yours is going to work, goblin? I'm taking a real risk siding with you, and it'll be our heads if we're discovered!

'The dragon who commands the hobgoblins might be trapped behind the Anvil of Winterstith, but that has not decreased their numbers here! They're pushing us out, Orcs and goblins both! I don't like it. And why hasn't Gorgar stood up to them? Bah.'

Muzmák peers around suspiciously and lowers his voice.

'So the plan is still on? We'll join the next raiding party heading south, and once free of the mountains we'll slip away? We'll set up somewhere far from Gundabad, far from Gorgar, and far from these accursed hobgoblins? Okay. I've chosen three others who might join us. Speak to them and see what you think, goblin. Their names are Shulgolb, Lumbag, and Zogmauk, and they're all here in Durshulot.'
Continue your flight from the war
Talk to Muzmák as he catches his breath

'You're part of Muzmák's gang, eh? If we get found out I'm tellin' Gorgar it was all his idea. Are you okay with that, Glúrkub?\n\n'Then I'm in. Gorgar is losing his power to the hobgoblins, day by day. Won't be good for any of us to still be here when he loses the last of it!'
Survive the reemergence of Hrímil Frost-heart

'Count me in, Glúrkub. This place won't be safe for us when the hobgoblins take over!

'Who plans to lead the raiding-party we will join? Natsatúg? Ah, that is good to know. It won't be easy, but I think I can get my hands on some of the badges his boys wear when they leave the mountain. You know the ones, with the thunderclouds on 'em?

'We'll blend right in, and when we're safely in the country we'll slip away for our better lives. It's a good plan.'
Talk to Muzmák
'I could join your little band, it's true.\n\n'Or I could turn you and your friends in for traitors and cowards!'

'Are they with us? Ah, I wondered about Zogmauk. At least he has been dealt with before he could cause us any more -'

Muzmák suddenly stops speaking.

'What is that? Someone comes!'

'I need you to come with me, goblin. You are just what I need for my purposes.'

Gorgar scowls at the line of goblins, every one of whom wears a relieved expression.

'I have seen the glint of mithril inside an old tomb, but the entrance is sealed by a great rock-fall. No Orc can make it through the opening, and it might be too small for most goblins. But you, I think, will serve. You will bring me this treasure, and be rewarded by Gorgar the Generous.'
'What did you say? A great force of dwarves approaches the mountain? Even now they near Elderslade, and Gorgar commands that I fight on his behalf?'
Talk to Zogmauk
Talk to Muzmák in Durshulot
Remain alert during Gorgar's inspection
'Death to dwarves!'
Talk to Gorgar the Ruthless
Carry out Gorgar's plan
Collect the mithril treasure sought by Gorgar
Continue working for Gorgar
Command Ránulur to fight on behalf of Gorgar
'Goblins! Line up!'
'I am free! I am freeeeee!'
'Now the extent of my vengeance shall be known!'
'No, I didn't kill him. I just scared him a little, and it was enough!'
'Who speaks to me?'
'I am Ránulur, Chieftain of Wargs! I serve no Orc!'
'Pitiful, unthinking insects.'
'Why should I not devour you in a single gulp, goblin?'
'The dwarves do nothing I have not commanded!'
'He cannot best the hobgoblins, let alone an army of dwarves.'
'It was I who spoke to their prince through the ice!'
'I will answer his call, goblin.'
'It was I who planted the thought of this conquest in his mind!'
'He is powerless to resist my Dragon-Voice!'
'For now.'
'Follow me, my new subjects.'
Instance: The Divided Loyalties of Glúrkub the Goblin
'This is our last test, boys!'
'If we want our freedom, we've got to fight for it!'
'Lumbag!'
'Shulgolb!'
'Glúrkub!'
Muzmák is waiting to speak with you.
'These dwarves stand between us and escape!'
'Kill the dwarves!'
'One more thing, Glúrkub.'
Durin snorts. 'Good idea,' he says.
'If you betray me...'
Muzmák gave you the names of three similar-minded residents of Durshulot who might help you escape from the growing conflict beneath Gundabad.
'Let's just say you don't want to do that.'
Muzmák is waiting to speak with you.
'You're dead, goblin!'
'I give up, I give up! Your secret is safe with me!'
'It was a good plan. All of my plans are good plans!'
'Of course it was a good plan!'
'None can survive the surprising strength of mighty Glúrkub!'
'Uh oh.'
'It wasn't a question. It was a command.'
'It was a hammer, a shiny hammer made of precious mithril.'
'I was rewarded for it. I became Gorgar's most trusted lieutenant.'
Glúrkub has a tale to tell... but how much of it can be believed?
'It had been a good plan. But plans change.'
'I did Gorgar's bidding in all things... no matter how dangerous.'
'Follow me to Gundabad, and the final defeat of the dwarves!'
'It would go very badly for you, goblin.'
'You want Muzmák for a friend, trust me.'
'So you stick to the plan.'
'Gorgar!'
'...or if any of your buddies get cold feet and turn me in...'
'Kill the dwarves! Kill them all!'
'Hrímil Frost-heart!'
'We were the defenders of Gundabad, mighty one...'
'But now a dwarf army lays siege to the mountain! That place is lost!'
'Goblin, are you through? Do you see the treasure?'
Defeat Zogmauk
'Can it be?'
Follow Muzmák further across the snowfield
Return to Gundabad
Listen to Muzmák in Durshulot
Talk to Muzmák in Durshulot
Slay many dwarves during the War of Three Peaks
